natural problem:
It can be shown that for any positive integer $n,$
\[\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix}^n = \begin{pmatrix} F_{n + 1} & F_n \\ F_n & F_{n - 1} \end{pmatrix},\]where $F_n$ denotes the $n$th Fibonacci number.

Compute $F_{784} F_{786} - F_{785}^2.$
natural solution: Since $\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix}^n = \begin{pmatrix} F_{n + 1} & F_n \\ F_n & F_{n - 1} \end{pmatrix},$ \[\det \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix}^n = \det \begin{pmatrix} F_{n + 1} & F_n \\ F_n & F_{n - 1} \end{pmatrix}.\]Now, \[\det \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix}^n = \left( \det \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix} \right)^n = (-1)^n,\]and

\[\det \begin{pmatrix} F_{n + 1} & F_n \\ F_n & F_{n - 1} \end{pmatrix} = F_{n + 1} F_{n - 1} - F_n^2,\]so \[F_{n + 1} F_{n - 1} - F_n^2 = (-1)^n.\]In particular, taking $n = 785,$ we get $F_{784} F_{786} - F_{785}^2 = \boxed{-1}.$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes F :: "nat \<Rightarrow> int"
assumes h0 : "F 0 = 0"
and h1 : "F 1 = 1"
and h2 : "\<forall>n. n \<ge> 2 \<longrightarrow> F n = F (n - 1) + F (n - 2)"
shows  "F 784 * F 786 - F 785 ^ 2 = -1"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 It can be shown that for any positive integer $n,$
\[\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix}^n = \begin{pmatrix} F_{n + 1} & F_n \\ F_n & F_{n - 1} \end{pmatrix},\]where $F_n$ denotes the $n$th Fibonacci number.

 \[\det \begin{pmatrix} F_{n + 1} & F_n \\ F_n & F_{n - 1} \end{pmatrix} = F_{n + 1} F_{n - 1} - F_n^2,\]so \[F_{n + 1} F_{n - 1} - F_n^2 = (-1)^n.\]In particular, taking $n = 785,$ we get $F_{784} F_{786} - F_{785}^2 = \boxed{-1}.$

theorem
fixes F :: "nat \<Rightarrow> int"
assumes h0 : "F 0 = 0"
and h1 : "F 1 = 1"
and h2 : "\<forall>n. n \<ge> 2 \<longrightarrow> F n = F (n - 1) + F (n - 2)"
shows  "F 784 * F 786 - F 785 ^ 2 = -1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: A sequence $F$ is defined by the recursive formula $F(n)=F(n-1)+F(n-2)$ for all integers $n\geq2$, with initial conditions $F(0)=0$ and $F(1)=1$. Prove that $F(784)*F(786)-F(785)^2=-1$.

 \[\det \begin{pmatrix} F_{n + 1} & F_n \\ F_n & F_{n - 1} \end{pmatrix} = F_{n + 1} F_{n - 1} - F_n^2,\]so \[F_{n + 1} F_{n - 1} - F_n^2 = (-1)^n.\]In particular, taking $n = 785,$ we get $F_{784} F_{786} - F_{785}^2 = \boxed{-1}.$
 *)

  show ?thesis sledgehammer

Find the value of $F(784)*F(786)-(F(785))^2$. The final answer is $-1$.

 \[\det \begin{pmatrix} F_{n + 1} & F_n \\ F_n & F_{n - 1} \end{pmatrix} = F_{n + 1} F_{n - 1} - F_n^2,\]so \[F_{n + 1} F_{n - 1} - F_n^2 = (-1)^n.\]In particular, taking $n = 785,$ we get $F_{784} F_{786} - F_{785}^2 = \boxed{-1}.$

and h1 : "F 1 = 1"

Find the value of $F(784) * F(786) - (F(785))^2$. The final answer is $-1$.

and h1 : "F 1 = 1"
and h2 : "\<forall>n \<ge> 2. F n = F (n - 1) + F (n - 2)"
shows  "F 784 * F 786 - (F 785) powr 2 = -1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem: A sequence $F$ is defined recursively by $F(0)=0$, $F(1)=1$ and $F(n)=F(n-1)+F(n-2)$ for all integers $n \geq 2$. Find the value of $F(784) \cdot F(786) - (F(785))^2$. The final answer is $-1$.
